title: Deport all Illegal immigrants, exit Nato, pardon Jan 6 defendants: Trump lays out his agenda
content: In his first post-election interview, President-elect Trump outlined his second-term agenda, including pardons for January 6th rioters, ending birthright citizenship, and mass deportations. He also discussed potential NATO withdrawal, tariffs, and a more unifying message than his previous inaugural address. Surprisingly, Trump met with Macron and Zelenskyy in Paris after the interview to discuss peace in Ukraine.
summary: In his first post-election interview, President-elect Trump outlined his second-term agenda, including pardons for January 6th rioters, ending birthright citizenship, and mass deportations.  He also discussed potential NATO withdrawal, tariffs, and a more unifying message than his previous inaugural address.  Surprisingly, Trump met with Macron and Zelenskyy in Paris after the interview to discuss peace in Ukraine.

title: 'Child's first heartbreak shouldn't be from father', says Roberts as Hunter Biden yet to meet their daughter
content: Lunden Roberts, mother of Hunter Biden's child, reveals his continued absence from their daughter's life. Hunter has not met Navy and stopped communicating with her eight months ago. Roberts and Biden had a relationship between 2016 and 2018. A DNA test confirmed Hunter's paternity. Roberts claims Hunter has missed key moments in Navy's life.
summary: Lunden Roberts, mother of Hunter Biden's child, reveals his continued absence from their daughter's life. Hunter has not met Navy and stopped communicating with her eight months ago. Roberts and Biden had a relationship between 2016 and 2018. A DNA test confirmed Hunter's paternity. Roberts claims Hunter has missed key moments in Navy's life.

title: Fall of Assad: Israel PM says military has seized buffer zone in Golan Heights
content: Israeli forces secured a buffer zone in the Golan Heights after Syrian rebels ousted President Bashar al-Assad, ending his family's rule. Prime Minister Netanyahu declared this a "historic day," attributing it to Israeli actions against Iran and Hezbollah, Assad's allies. Israel's annexation of the Golan Heights remains internationally disputed.
summary: Israeli forces secured a buffer zone in the Golan Heights after Syrian rebels ousted President Bashar al-Assad, ending his family's rule.  Prime Minister Netanyahu declared this a "historic day," attributing it to Israeli actions against Iran and Hezbollah, Assad's allies.  Israel's annexation of the Golan Heights remains internationally disputed.

title: Chinese woman wins over Rs 1 lakh for being away from phone for 8 hours
content: A woman in China won 10,000 yuan after successfully abstaining from mobile phone use for eight hours in a competition. Ten contestants lay on beds in a shopping mall, prohibited from using electronic devices except for basic calls. The winner, nicknamed "pyjama sister," maintained the lowest anxiety levels and spent the most time in bed, achieving a score of 88.99.
summary: A woman in China won 10,000 yuan after successfully abstaining from mobile phone use for eight hours in a competition.  Ten contestants lay on beds in a shopping mall, prohibited from using electronic devices except for basic calls.  The winner, nicknamed "pyjama sister," maintained the lowest anxiety levels and spent the most time in bed, achieving a score of 88.99.

title: Why United is taking families to 'North Pole' on free 'fantasy flights'
content: United Airlines launched its Fantasy Flights program, taking children facing hardship on a magical journey to the 'North Pole.' Flight 3894 from Honolulu marked the start, with 125 children and their families enjoying a festive experience. Thirteen such flights are planned across the globe, spreading holiday cheer to families affected by military loss or childhood cancer.
summary: United Airlines launched its Fantasy Flights program, taking children facing hardship on a magical journey to the 'North Pole.'  Flight 3894 from Honolulu marked the start, with 125 children and their families enjoying a festive experience.  Thirteen such flights are planned across the globe, spreading holiday cheer to families affected by military loss or childhood cancer.

title: Where Turkey stands as Syrian government falls to opposition insurgents

Where is Bashar al-Assad? Vanished plane from radar deepens mystery amid rebel takeover
content: Rebels seized Damascus, ending Assad's 24-year reign. He reportedly fled on a plane whose fate is unknown. His family's location is also unconfirmed. The swift rebel advance leaves Syria's future uncertain, with Assad's whereabouts a mystery. The rebel offensive, which began a week ago with the surprise capture of northern Aleppo, quickly snowballed. Cities fell one after another as Assad’s forces were unable to hold their ground.
summary: Rebels seized Damascus, ending Assad's 24-year reign.  He reportedly fled on a plane whose fate is unknown.  His family's location is also unconfirmed.  The swift rebel advance leaves Syria's future uncertain, with Assad's whereabouts a mystery. The rebel offensive, which began a week ago with the surprise capture of northern Aleppo, quickly snowballed. Cities fell one after another as Assad’s forces were unable to hold their ground.

title: Watch: Syrians storm presidential palace, loot Assad’s personal belongings
content: Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad fled Damascus as opposition forces entered the capital, encountering minimal resistance. Citizens celebrated, storming the presidential palace and toppling Assad statues. Rebel groups, including some with al-Qaeda ties, seized state media and declared imminent victory after capturing Homs, a key city.
summary: Syrian dictator Bashar al-Assad fled Damascus as opposition forces entered the capital, encountering minimal resistance.  Citizens celebrated, storming the presidential palace and toppling Assad statues.  Rebel groups, including some with al-Qaeda ties, seized state media and declared imminent victory after capturing Homs, a key city.

title: Stability or civil war? What lies ahead for post-Assad Syria
content: Islamist-led rebels seized control of Damascus on Sunday, compelling President Bashar al-Assad to flee and ending over five decades of Baath Party rule. Celebrations erupted in the streets as the rebels declared the city liberated.
summary: Islamist-led rebels seized control of Damascus on Sunday, compelling President Bashar al-Assad to flee and ending over five decades of Baath Party rule. Celebrations erupted in the streets as the rebels declared the city liberated.

title: Rescuers search for victims after explosion at Dutch apartment block that killed at least 5
Romanian police raid homes after presidential election declared invalid
content: Romanian prosecutors raided houses in Brasov following the invalidation of the first-round presidential election due to allegations of Russian interference and campaign irregularities. The court's decision cancels the planned second-round vote, and a new election date will be set. The investigation focuses on illegal campaign funding and potential ties to far-right candidate Calin Georgescu, who unexpectedly won the first round.
summary: Romanian prosecutors raided houses in Brasov following the invalidation of the first-round presidential election due to allegations of Russian interference and campaign irregularities.  The court's decision cancels the planned second-round vote, and a new election date will be set.  The investigation focuses on illegal campaign funding and potential ties to far-right candidate Calin Georgescu, who unexpectedly won the first round.

title: NYPD releases fresh photographs of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson's alleged assassin
content: Police released new images of the masked suspect in the targeted killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including one from inside a taxi. The suspect, who traveled from Atlanta, shot Thompson three times outside a Midtown hotel before fleeing to Central Park, discarding a backpack containing a jacket and Monopoly money.
summary: Police released new images of the masked suspect in the targeted killing of UnitedHealthcare CEO Brian Thompson, including one from inside a taxi. The suspect, who traveled from Atlanta, shot Thompson three times outside a Midtown hotel before fleeing to Central Park, discarding a backpack containing a jacket and Monopoly money.

title: Imran Khan's party to launch more protests against government to secure his release, says Khyber Pakhtunkhwa CM
Syrian Rebel chief who toppled Assad: How Abu Mohammed al-Jolani rebranded himself as a 'moderate' leader
content: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, former leader of al-Qaeda's Syrian branch, is rebranding himself as a moderate political figure. He broke from al-Qaeda in 2016, forming Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), and now presents a more pragmatic image. Despite this shift, HTS continues to face accusations of human rights abuses, and his transformation is viewed with skepticism by many.
summary: Abu Mohammed al-Jolani, former leader of al-Qaeda's Syrian branch, is rebranding himself as a moderate political figure.  He broke from al-Qaeda in 2016, forming Hayat Tahrir al-Sham (HTS), and now presents a more pragmatic image. Despite this shift,  HTS continues to face accusations of human rights abuses, and his transformation is viewed with skepticism by many.

title: Russia says Syria's Assad has left country and gave orders for peaceful power handover
content: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has resigned and left the country after negotiations with parties involved in the conflict, according to the Russian Foreign Ministry. Russia stated it did not participate in the negotiations but is urging all sides to avoid violence and pursue political solutions. Russian military bases in Syria are on high alert.
summary: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad has resigned and left the country after negotiations with parties involved in the conflict, according to the Russian Foreign Ministry.  Russia stated it did not participate in the negotiations but is urging all sides to avoid violence and pursue political solutions.  Russian military bases in Syria are on high alert.

title: Spain says backs 'peaceful', 'stable' solution for Syria
content: Spain's Foreign Minister, Jose Manuel Albares, expressed hope for a peaceful transition in Syria following reports of President Bashar al-Assad's departure and the fall of Damascus to rebels. Albares emphasized the importance of Syrian self-determination, territorial integrity, and regional stability. He confirmed the safety of the small Spanish community in Syria amid the rapidly unfolding events.
summary: Spain's Foreign Minister, Jose Manuel Albares, expressed hope for a peaceful transition in Syria following reports of President Bashar al-Assad's departure and the fall of Damascus to rebels.  Albares emphasized the importance of Syrian self-determination, territorial integrity, and regional stability. He confirmed the safety of the small Spanish community in Syria amid the rapidly unfolding events.

title: Melbourne synagogue fire an act of 'terrorism': Australian PM
content: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese condemned a Melbourne synagogue fire as "terrorism" and highlighted rising anti-Semitism. Arsonists gutted the Adass Israel Synagogue, prompting a police investigation. The attack drew international condemnation, with some criticizing the Australian government's stance on anti-Semitism and its recent UN vote concerning Israel.
summary: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese condemned a Melbourne synagogue fire as "terrorism" and highlighted rising anti-Semitism.  Arsonists gutted the Adass Israel Synagogue, prompting a police investigation.  The attack drew international condemnation, with some criticizing the Australian government's stance on anti-Semitism and its recent UN vote concerning Israel.

title: Meet the Assads: How rebel forces toppled Syria’s decades-long dynasty
content: After over five decades of Assad family rule, President Bashar al-Assad has fled Damascus as rebel forces breach the Syrian capital. The Alawite dynasty, established by Hafez al-Assad in 1970, maintained power through strategic manipulation of sectarian divisions. Bashar, inheriting power in 2000, failed to implement reforms, leading to the 2011 uprising and subsequent civil war.
summary: After over five decades of Assad family rule, President Bashar al-Assad has fled Damascus as rebel forces breach the Syrian capital. The Alawite dynasty, established by Hafez al-Assad in 1970, maintained power through strategic manipulation of sectarian divisions. Bashar, inheriting power in 2000, failed to implement reforms, leading to the 2011 uprising and subsequent civil war.
